65.67.text:
appropriate name, since the
flavor of a garden tomato

71.97.text:
I'm Mary Holm, and today

we are going to learn how

78.86.text:
so we can enjoy it not just

85.26.text:
Let's learn how to preserve
the paradise apple.

Sometimes in the middle

- I always wait until

190.46.text:

193.95.text:

It's one of the vegetables

a lot blemishes on them,

because those have things

242.25.text:

252.08.text: pretty much the basics for it.

254.75.text:

if we have a frost,

257.32.text:
because sometimes, you
know, we're getting to

259.54.text: the end of the season, we still got about

260.92.text:
a gazillion tomatoes out

tomatoes that are on

269.43.text:
the plants that have
been killed by a frost.

let be because the plant

280.96.text: so you should not use those.

283.77.text:
But you can pick them, if you
have a warning of a frost,

287.57.text:
you can pick them before a
frost comes, bring them inside.

293.51.text:
As I said, take them to
a darker place with a

296.35.text:
temperature between 55
and 60, for them to ripen

300.72.text:
in a single layer, and you

306.27.text: - Now is it hard to preserve tomatoes?

308.77.text:
- No, I think tomatoes
are probably one of the

312.03.text: easiest vegetables in the garden to can.

317.23.text:
For one thing, it sits
right on the edge on the pH,

321.97.text:
you know the high acid
fruits have a lower pH,

327.50.text:
and the things like corn
and squash and those

331.27.text:
have a high pH, and the tomatoes
sit right in the middle.

335.41.text:
So we do have to do some additives
to them when we can them,

340.31.text:
but they're very easy to
can, and you can use a

343.53.text:
hot water bath method,
which is, for many people,
